content.question: A long cylindrical object is made from a material in which charge carriers can move. The figure shows a section of the object, along with three labeled points along the objectâ€™s length and the electric potential at each labeled point. Which of the following gives the correct directions for the current in the regions between points <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>, <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math>, and <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math>?

choices.label: The current is directed inward toward point <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> from points <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math> and <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math>.

The current is directed outward from point <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> toward points <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math> and <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math>.

The current is directed toward the right, from point <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math> toward point <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> as well as from point <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> toward point <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math>.

The current is directed toward the left, from point <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> toward point <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> as well as from point <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> toward point <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>.

content.answer: The current is directed toward the left, from point <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> toward point <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> as well as from point <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> toward point <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>.
